description: This table keeps an audit trail of web-based chart system status changes made to a patient. This table can be used to determine when, who, and how a status was changed for a patient account. Every time the status is modified, a new row is added to this table.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: MYC_STAT_HX_C_NAME
columns.description:
The activation status category number for the patient.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Activated


Inactivated


Pending Activation


Non Standard MyChart Status


Patient Declined


Activation Code Generated, but Disabled

columns.name: MYC_STAT_HX_EMP_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the employee that has changed status.

columns.name: MYC_STAT_HX_CMT
columns.description: Item to store comments for status changes

columns.name: MYC_STAT_HX_MTHD_C_NAME
columns.description:
The method of the status change for patients. This can be used to determine how or why the status was changed. For example, this could be used to find the method of activation code generation that is most successful for patient signup.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


MyChart Administration Activity


MyChart Patient Utilities (text)


Launch MyChart Signup


SmartText


E-mailed Activation Code (Success)


Kiosk


EpicWeb Utilities


Web Service


Patient Deceased


Extension Web Service


Failed Login or Signup Attempts


EPT Deactivated


MyChart Signup (Web Site)


Patient Merge/Unmerge


Proxy Access Activity (Enable Non-Patient)


Procedure Order


Patient Declined Duration Expired


Proxy Only With No Proxies


E-mailed Activation Code (Failure)


Proxy Access Activity (Non-Patient Activation Code Generated)


Proxy Access Activity (Disable Non-Patient)


Proxy Access Activity (Enable for Proxy)


Auto Activated via Federated Login System


Prelude/Cadence Popup


Open Scheduling


Status Display Extension


MyChart Signup (Bedside)


Billing Correspondence


Self-Signup (Success)


Self-Signup (Failure)


Proxy MyChart Activated (Enable for Proxy)


Instant Activation


Patient Declined Terms and Conditions


After Visit Summary


Batch Job


Patient Checked for MyChart Eligibility


Happy Together


Registration (Non-Patient Activation Code Generated)


Auto Activated via Newborn Admission Extension


Auto Instant Activation


System Correction


Unverified Proxy Video Visit


Instant Activation On The Fly Code Generation


Demographic Authentication


Kanta Document Generation


Demographic Authentication (eCheck-In for All)


User Deactivated Own Account


Print Activation Instructions (Dialog Launched)


Print Activation Instructions (User Cancelled)


Fast Pass SMS


PGO Data Request

columns.name: DEPARTMENT_ID
columns.description: The department logged in to during the status change if applicable. This only applies to status changes done by a user in Hyperspace.

columns.name: WORKSTATION_ID
columns.description: The workstation record used when the status was changed. This only applies to Welcome workstations and workflows within Welcome that change the status of the patient account.

columns.name: MYC_PROXY_ACTIVATION_YN
columns.description:
Flag indicating whether an activation status is due to a proxy or not.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes
